reviews.review_msg: Yildiz classes are fun and full of useful information. One of my favourite profs at sfu. this is one of the a few classes in which i didnt fall asleep.

She sure is passionate about the topics but loves the sound of her own voice too much. Holds an unnecessarily long 4 hour lecture that is painfully boring. Way too much work for one class, and her grading makes no sense. Plus there was no opportunity to go over grades and receive reasonable feedback. Doesnt even use canvas. DO NOT TAKE AS ELECTIVE

Yildiz is awesome. Has an awesome sociological framework, and brings an interesting perspective to all class discussions. Ive taken a couple of courses with her, and they were both good. The assignments are fair, although challenging. No exams, and no big papers. overall, A grade prof.

Seems to be polarized opinions, either u hate her or love her.  I hated her, but i wouldn't take the chance of possibly liking her.  The odds of hating her are much greater and u'll suffer the consequences all semester! Extremely rude and fake, likes to put students down

ABSOLUTELY HATE HER! Do not recommend her to anyone.  Way too opinionated, just there to prove to the world that she has a PhD and we're only stupid students with no knowledge or intellectual minds of our own.  Has no problem stating that her OPINIONS are correct and yours are wrong, despite the word opinion

HOLY SMOKES! is all to have say..I would not even reccommend this course to my worst enenmy its horrible & does not even relate to socilology..its more about history & global politcs work load is enormours 13 items due this sem NO exams..which is okay but mateiral on Isalm is too complex & her book is too 2 difficult to follow no structure

very passionate about what she teaches which makes her very intimidating. if she doesn't like your ideas she will tell you to your face, "NO, you are wrong that's not right". but she is very helpfull & very good at marking things on time, you get everything back one week after handing it in!

Chris gives tons of feedback and is a fair marker. People say he is tough and rude but hey, get over it. You are in University. Life is tough. If you want to learn things take his class. Very well structured and the amount of feedback he gives makes getting a good grade very realistic.

Stacy is a very knowledgeable professor.  She believes that reading will help students to understand the "local perspectives" in a culture.  But, sometimes there are too much reading to get that that one theme she is trying to point out. look go

Stacy is a very passionate academic, but she assigns way too much reading which should have been considered "recommended" instead of "manditory".She is really disorganized.I really liked the classroom environment and the course materia
i was excited about this class but i cant honestly it was wirth the time

aaaaaaaaaahhhhhh.i agree with all of the other comments. stacey should stick with grad classes. she demonstrates a high level of interest in her topic but come on we are undergrads, be resonable, we arent pashionate about anything but graduating.
